description:
We all agree that continuous delivery (CD) is important. However, CD is not a discipline on it’s own (at least, not yet) and the science behind it is rarely covered in schools.

This talk will cover:

* Domain Driven Design (DDD) for CD, based on concepts authored by Eric Evans
* How the CD Pipeline, along with its assets, can be orchestrated with Jenkins
* Pipeline patterns that improve speed, quality and reliability
* Pipeline anti-patterns 
* Microservices Test Architecture that is “hand-in-glove” with the Pipeline
* KPIs to measure ROI from the Pipeline
* CD for IoT
title: Continuous Delivery Pipeline - Patterns and Anti-Patterns
